jobs.title: Account Director (Audio/Digital)
jobs.description:
About Us

The Athletic is a direct-to-consumer digital sports media company committed to helping subscribers experience storytelling in a whole new way. Founded in 2016 and headquartered in San Francisco, The Athletic has more than 575 full-time employees and covers more than 250 professional sports and collegiate teams in the US, Canada and the UK. The Athletic’s newsroom has produced thousands of in-depth articles along with more than 120 podcasts and premium video content.

About the Role

The Athletic produces nearly 150 daily and weekly podcasts that are free to listeners on platforms like Apple and Spotify. We are building an in-house ad sales and operations team to sell and deliver ads on these podcasts. In this role, you will be responsible for owning the end to end sales process for new ad partners who want to get their brand/product in the ears of our listeners. Additionally, you will be responsible for maintaining and nurturing relationships with existing ad partners in order to drive renewals and support ongoing business. Location is flexible and some travel may be required. 


Responsibilities
- Independently own the end-to-end ad sales process
- Managing junior sales members.
- Identify ad partners that have a brand/product that is a strong fit with our listener base, and navigate to the appropriate decision-maker at each partner
- Schedule meetings with decision-makers and lead the pitch for why our shows are a good fit for the partner’s advertising needs
- Negotiate a campaign’s ad format, frequency, duration, cost, and other key terms
- Meet ambitious individual and team-level quarterly revenue targets
- Generate partner insights and sales lessons and share them across the team
- Represent The Athletic brand 


Requirements 
- 6+ years of sales experience. 
- Strong preference for Podcast ad sales experience. 
- Previous team lead or managerial experience.
- Strategic thinker w/ ability to map out quarterly and annual execution plans.
- Excellent written and verbal communication 
- Ability to improve on existing processes and implement new ones  
- Strong attention to detail 
- You love the sales process and are motivated by ambitious targets
- You are good at working independently but enjoy being part of a team

We are seeking a highly motivated Art Director to be the first member of a team dedicated to producing high quality artwork for our editorial content. Our small but mighty Data Team owns all data infrastructure for The Athletic: MySQL production database, analytics data streaming pipeline using Kafka, Glue, S3, and Redshift, all hosted in AWS. The team works on many different things: scaling our data infrastructure, modeling, recommendations, product features, data visualization - it’s never boring! We have lots of exciting things we want to build and we don't have enough time to build them. That's where you come in! 

You'll be leading a team of data engineers and data scientists using cutting edge technology to build and deploy the tools and data infrastructure that power our platform. You should be interested in building systems for scale, performance, and reliability. We all wear a lot of hats, so you’ll have the opportunity to work on database administration, infrastructure, ETL, microservice and model deployment, testing, experiments, and more depending on your interests.  We’re a team of generalists interested in continuously learning new areas and we’ll expect you to be one as well. Our team is always experimenting and we trust and encourage our engineers to dream up and try out their own ideas and features.

Headquarters is located in San Francisco, but we are open to areas such as Los Angeles, Austin, New York or other remote locations. 


Responsiblities
- Lead a team of data engineers and data scientists. Architect solutions, provide mentorship, give guidance
- Partner with Product and Engineering teams to build and deploy features backed by machine learning and modern data toolsets
- Inform, influence, support, and execute our product decisions
- Build/maintain reports, dashboards, and metrics to monitor the performance of our products
- Mine massive amounts of data and extract useful product insights
- Manage development of data resources, gather requirements, organize sources, and support product launches

- Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Math, Physics, Engineering, or related quantitative field
- 5+ years data engineering experience
- 2+ years of experience in leading or managing a team
- 2+ years of experience with Python, SQL or other programming languages
- 2+ years of experience with Docker, AWS, or similar environment
- Experience initiating and driving projects to completion with minimal guidance
- Experience communicating the results of analysis

- Experience with Kafka, Kubernetes, Redshift and Spark
- Experience with large data sets and distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop).
